item.title: TMC - Defects - Road Markings problem, 11th September
item.description:
FADED ROAD MARKINGS PLEASE REPAINT 9 X DOUBLE DOTS 11. X SINGLE DOTS 3 X CENTRE LINES STOP AND GO (Faded Road Markings)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction frequently blocked by queueing traffic, 11th September
item.description:
Due to 9 months of roadworks, cars queueing up Shurdington road block the junction for Hillfort Close, causing further delays when cars are attempting to turn right into the road. Please can you paint appropriate road markings to ensure driver behaviour keeps what is already a congested stretch of road running a bit better . A box junction eould be ideal
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Hilfort Close, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large area of tarmac all broken up and now rapidly disappearing making cars swerve onto the wrong side of the lane, 11th September
item.description:
On Hayden Lane between 1 Hayden Lane and Hayden Knowle. Inline with near side car wheels travelling FROM House in the Tree pub end. Possibly a previous large area patch repair has failed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary Traffic Lights but work has finished, 10th September
item.description:
Please take away the temp lights on Innsworth Lane opposite Little Norman junction. The work has finished but lights still on causing tail backs at rush hours. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sunk / dip, 10th September
item.description:
Near the gateway to the public open space on Coldpool Lane. The road surface has sunk, creating quite a violent jolt when travelling at 40mph. Dangerous for motorcyclists and very uncomfortable for passengers travelling in wheelchair vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light on pathway obstructed by vegetation, 10th September
item.description:
The lamp post has a number 22 on. The first picture gives one unobstructed view. The second picture shows the level of obstruction. The third picture shows you that no light shines onto the path into this particularly dark area of the pathway. For those walking on the path at night or dusk it presents a hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Craven Drive, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
